column2: and FWIW, on my home system, doing  process.env.PATH   in the developer tools results in:  process.env.PATH "/usr/local/heroku/bin:/Users/john/.rbenv/shims:/usr/local/bin:/usr/bin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/sbin"  which looks like my home system is doing the right thing...
I will look into it more and get back to you.

Even if we go with "item" instead of "file" and don't change "editor" to "editorgroup" that only saves 8 breaking changes (ex. focusFirstEditor, etc). Given that "editor" doesn't show up often in the UI, "editor" is probably fine and accurate enough (ignoring readonly cases).  We'll need to be careful to correctly call out "editor" and "editor groups" in commands and try to leave other commands generic (for example: I think we should change "Keep Editor" to "Keep Open" https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/8026).

I'm running into the same error. I can git push from the command line, but can't through VS Code. I get the following error:  > Please make sure you have the correct access rights > and the repository exists.  I downloaded and installed the credential helper then tried both: `git config credential.helper cache` as well as  `git config credential.helper store` but still doesn't work.  ps. I'm using version 1.2.1  Thanks a lot for your support.
I can repro this with some other debug adapter too.

Creating a symlink fixes the issue to run vscode in a cygwin (babun) open a cmd prompt and use the following command: mklink /j "W:\cygdrive" C:\actual\path\to\your\cygdrive  posted solution on stackoverflow : http://stackoverflow.com/questions/36508177/visual-studio-code-cannot-detect-cygwin-git-exe-path/37980938#37980938

@gregvanl Another usecase where user wants to toggle focus between editor and Problems view (or other views in bottom) - While fixing problems or debugging its most common to navigate between editor and views. Currently, you would need to toggle the view twice to get this.
I assume this is with Razor.

-1 for this proposal - I personally do not think it is adding value for the output and debug panel. The users are already used to the current behavior and changing that might break their muscle memory.  As Ben pointed out giving the focus to the output does not make much sense also. If you disagree then we should bring this item up on the next ux meeting.
Then it is a dup of https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/4526 which needs to be fixed in the TS support we use.
@paulvanbrenk thanks for the PR.

This is a TS server issues tracked here: https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/7762 and will be fixed in the next tsserver release.  If this is blocking for you, you can try to use the tsserver from the TS nightly build which already contains a fix for this. See https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/languages/typescript#_using-newer-typescript-versions on how to do this.

I am not a gulp expert but to my knowledge gulp doesn't replace {{file}} with a real file name. How would gulp know which file to take.  However, what you can do is to use ${file} inside the tasks.json to pass the current open file to gulp. See https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/tasks#_variable-substitution for examples and which variables are available.
@beliefgp this is currently not support. If you need this, please file an feature request here https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript which provides JS and TS formatting for VS Code.

@LarryWeiss With the german keyboard, while I do have the same default keymapping configuration as you have, I get the following using your steps:  ![vscode_zoom](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8385202/16299530/20ac9640-393b-11e6-83ee-0980e1c7877c.png)  The actual working keymapping is [Ctrl +], as advertised in the menus and the command palette.  This is imho the proper mapping for the german keyboard, since [Ctrl =] would require a very awkward shift-key combination.  Funny though as this is not what is configured in keymapping, there might be some locale-specific adjustment voodoo going on here?

@dbaeumer here is gist you can clone: https://gist.github.com/Ciantic/50140f189abf3e83260e6aba7cedc5ce  Clone that, open the folder in VS Code insiders, open the "openthis.ts", hit Ctrl+T and start typing "globalStyles", nothing is found. But it finds "Something" just fine.  **Edit** I believe someone has designed Ctrl+T this way, but I can't understand why, having exported global values in symbols would be advantageous for navigation etc. If this is implemented: https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/188 the Ctrl+T could be used as primary GUI for importing a selected symbol, but it can't be used if it doesn't include all symbols.

It also reports all is well when there is a "next generation" firewall doing deep packet inspection on the https connections. This prevents updates from happening automatically within some corporate environments.
Did you configure your proxy settings in the `http.proxy` configuration setting?

Hi **@emiljas**, I'm your friendly neighborhood Microsoft Pull Request Bot (You can call me MSBOT). Thanks for your contribution! This seems like a small (but important) contribution, so no Contribution License Agreement is required at this point. Real humans will now evaluate your PR. TTYL, MSBOT;

There is no proxy to configure. The firewall sits as the default gateway and decrypts the https traffic and resigns it with its certificate (that is issued by our domains CA that is trusted by all domain computers). It appears that vscode is either either ignoring the results because it doesn't trust the cert, or the firewall is blocking the check. I don't believe it's the firewall as the logs indicate nothing is blocked. Where does vscode look for updates?

Here are more errors:  ``` warning: unable to access 'src/app/NEW_FOLDER/folder1/.gitattributes': Permission denied Using index info to reconstruct a base tree... warning: unable to access 'src/app/NEW_FOLDER/folder2/.gitattributes': Permission denied warning: unable to access 'src/app/NEW_FOLDER/file1': Permission denied Falling back to patching base and 3-way merge... error: cannot stat 'src/app/NEW_FOLDER/file2': Permission denied error: cannot stat 'src/app/NEW_FOLDER/file3': Permission denied error: Failed to merge in the changes. Patch failed at 0006 <<COMMIT_NAME>> ```  Basically, here is what I did: 1. Had a folder earlier in  `x/y/z` 2. Moved it to `a/b` 3. Committed this. 4. Did a `git pull --rebase` 5. Failed 6. Closed vscode 7. Ran `git pull --rebase` again 8. Success

Nice thoughts! - `onDidChangeModelRawContent` - we can probably remove those immediately - `IHTMLContentElement` vs `MarkedString` - +1 - definitely something to do. But only if we eliminate `IHTMLContentElement` from our codebase. I would not go for adaptor funny business. Do you wanna do it? - the model hierarchy comes from our codebase. Things are empty because the methods are marked internal. the .d.ts is not designed, it is generated. I can probably remove a couple of interfaces in there, but yes, there is a distinction between IReadOnlyModel and IModel (probably the most useful).
`vscode-update.azurewebsites.net` is the domain it connects to.
That's probably why we haven't whitelisted it. I'll try setting: http.proxyStrictSSL first, then ask our networking team to whitelist the domain. Will report back.
Thanks!

I can look at 'IHTMLContentElement'. Probably I won't be able to eliminate it all together, but replace the occurrences in Hover and IModelDecorationOptions with MarkedString to it doesn't appear in monaco.d.ts anymore
